com.moppyandroid.main.service

Class MusicQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moppyandroid.main.service.MusicQueue

  • public class MusicQueue
extends Object
    Represents a queue of MediaSessionCompat.QueueItems that manages the current playing item, as well as maintains a window to be used with MediaSessionCompat.setQueue(List).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  MusicQueue.Callback
      Callback triggered when the available queue manipulation options change.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int WINDOW_SIZE
      The maximum size of the queue window/subset handed to the MediaSessionCompat.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MusicQueue(MediaSessionCompat mediaSession)
      Constructs a MusicQueue without a MusicQueue.Callback.
      MusicQueue(MediaSessionCompat mediaSession, MusicQueue.Callback actionsCallback)
      Constructs a MusicQueue with a MusicQueue.Callback.

        actionsCallback - the callback triggered when the available actions change

    • Method Detail

      • addToQueue

        public void addToQueue(MediaDescriptionCompat description)
        Adds a song to the end of the music queue.
        Parameters:
        description - the song to add

      • addToQueue

        public boolean addToQueue(MediaDescriptionCompat description,
                          int index)
        Adds a song to the music queue at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        description - the song to add
        index - the index to insert the song at
        Returns:
        true if a song reload is suggested due to the song being inserted at the position of the currently-playing song
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index > getQueueSize() (one passed current final index)

      • removeFromQueue

        public boolean removeFromQueue(MediaDescriptionCompat description)
        Removes a specific song from the queue.
        Parameters:
        description - the song to remove
        Returns:
        true if the currently-playing song was removed and a song reload is necessary

      • removeFromQueue

        public boolean removeFromQueue(long id)
        Removes a specific song from the queue by its ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the song to remove
        Returns:
        true if the currently-playing song was removed and a song reload is necessary

      • removeFromQueue

        public boolean removeFromQueue(int index)
        Removes a song at a specific index from the queue.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the song to remove
        Returns:
        true if the currently-playing song was removed and a song reload is necessary
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= getQueueSize() (index of final song)

      • skipToSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToSong(long id)
        Skips to a specific song in the queue.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the song to skip to
        Returns:
        null if id doesn't match a song, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • skipToSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToSong(int index)
        Skips to the song at a specific index in the queue.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the song to skip to
        Returns:
        null if index doesn't exist in the queue, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • skipToNext

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToNext()
        Skips to the next song in the queue.
        Returns:
        null if there are no songs left in the queue, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • skipToNext

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToNext(int times)
        Skips forward in the queue a number of times. If there aren't enough songs left to skip forward the requested number of times, null is returned and the queue remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        times - the number of times to skip forward
        Returns:
        null if the queue couldn't be skipped as requested, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • skipToPrevious

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToPrevious()
        Skips to the previous song in the queue.
        Returns:
        null if there are no previous songs left in the queue, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • skipToPrevious

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem skipToPrevious(int times)
        Skips backward in the queue a number of times. If there aren't enough songs left to skip backward the requested number of times, null is returned and the queue remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        times - the number of times to skip backward
        Returns:
        null if the queue couldn't be skipped as requested, otherwise the song that was skipped to

      • getCurrentSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem getCurrentSong()
        Gets the currently-playing song.
        Returns:
        null if no song is supposed to be playing, otherwise the current song

      • peekSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem peekSong(long id)
        Gets the song associated with a specific ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the song to find
        Returns:
        null if no song is represented by id, otherwise the requested song
        See Also:
        skipToSong(long)

      • peekSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem peekSong(int index)
        Gets the song at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the song to find
        Returns:
        null if index doesn't exist in the queue, otherwise the requested song
        See Also:
        skipToSong(int)

      • peekWindowSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem peekWindowSong(int index)
        Gets the song at a specific index in the current window of the music queue.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the song to find
        Returns:
        null if the index doesn't exist in the window, otherwise the requested song
        See Also:
        skipToSong(int)

      • peekNextSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem peekNextSong()
        Gets the next song if available, without modifying the queue.
        Returns:
        null if there are no songs left in the queue, otherwise the next song
        See Also:
        skipToNext()

      • peekPreviousSong

        public MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem peekPreviousSong()
        Gets the previous song if available, without modifying the queue.
        Returns:
        null if there are no previous songs left in the queue, otherwise the previous song
        See Also:
        skipToPrevious()

      • checkSongAvailable

        public boolean checkSongAvailable(MediaDescriptionCompat description)
        Checks if a song is in the queue.
        Parameters:
        description - the song to check for
        Returns:
        true if description matches a song in the queue, otherwise false

      • checkSongAvailable

        public boolean checkSongAvailable(long id)
        Checks if an ID corresponds to a song in the queue.
        Parameters:
        id - the ID to find the associated song with
        Returns:
        true if id corresponds to a song in the queue, otherwise false

      • checkSongAvailable

        public boolean checkSongAvailable(int index)
        Checks if there is a song available at a specific index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index to check for a song
        Returns:
        true if index corresponds to a song in the queue, otherwise false

      • checkNextSongAvailable

        public boolean checkNextSongAvailable()
        Checks if there is another song forward in the queue that can be played with skipToNext().
        Returns:
        true if another song is available, otherwise false

      • checkPreviousSongAvailable

        public boolean checkPreviousSongAvailable()
        Checks if there are any previous songs in the queue that can be played with skipToPrevious().
        Returns:
        true if another song is available, otherwise false

      • getActions

        public long getActions()
        Gets the currently available PlaybackStateCompat actions.
        Returns:
        the currently available actions

      • getQueueSize

        public int getQueueSize()
        Gets the total size of the current music queue.
        Returns:
        the size of the queue

      • getQueueSublist

        public List<MediaSessionCompat.QueueItem> getQueueSublist(int fromIndex,
                                                          int toIndex)
        Gets a section of the current music queue between fromIndex (inclusive) and toIndex (exclusive).
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - the index of the first element to include, must be greater than 0
        toIndex - the index of the first element to not include, must be greater than fromIndex and not exceed getQueueSize()
        Returns:
        the sublist of the music queue in the range [fromIndex, toIndex)

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Gets the index of the playing song in the full music queue.
        Returns:
        the playing song's full index

      • getWindowOffset

        public int getWindowOffset()
        Gets the offset of the current window in the full music queue.
        Returns:
        the offset

      • getWindowIndex

        public int getWindowIndex()
        Gets the index of the playing item in the current window of the music queue.
        Returns:
        the playing item's window index
        See Also:
        getWindowOffset(), getIndex()

      • getNextSongCount

        public int getNextSongCount()
        Gets the number of songs forward in the queue, equivalent to the number of times skipToNext() can be successfully called. Doesn't include the current song.
        Returns:
        the number of songs ahead of the queue head

      • getPreviousSongCount

        public int getPreviousSongCount()
        Gets the number of songs backward in the queue, equivalent to the number of times skipToPrevious() can be successfully called. Doesn't include the current song.
        Returns:
        the number of songs behind the queue head
